intro: Dichocarpum wuchuanense, commonly known as the Wuchuan dichocarpum, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, hairy fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
